did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Albert J. and Roberta Wohlstetter Papers

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 844 manuscript boxes, 5 card file boxes, 8 oversize boxes

did.abstract: Contains speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, studies, and printed matter; relating to American military and national security policy, nuclear warfare strategic planning, and nuclear proliferation issues. Includes the papers of Roberta Wohlstetter, wife of Albert J. Wohlstetter.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research except for: Boxes 1-61, 201-354, 385-754, 815-821 and 838-857 which are closed

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert J. and Roberta Wohlstetter papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1997

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Contains speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, reports, studies, and printed matter; relating to American military and national security policy, nuclear warfare strategic planning, and nuclear proliferation issues. Includes the papers of Roberta Wohlstetter, wife of Albert J. Wohlstetter.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into ten series: Speeches and Writings, Roberta Wohlstetter File, Printed Matter, Photographs, Microfilm, Videotapes, Maps, Memorabilia, Card File, and Oversize Materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in Stanford University's online catalog.

scopecontent.p: This series includes background materials consisting of charts, graphs, maps, and transparencies used for presentation; briefings by and for Albert Wohlstetter; conferences he attended arranged in a general section and conferences he participated in arranged thereafter in chronological order; interviews by and of him; letters to the editor and newspaper articles; notes, a unique feature of his papers, arranged in chronological order, including short articles characterized by him as 'notes'; research materials, including related correspondence and memoranda, notes, and some drafts possibly used in his writings; speeches, including conversations, telephone and conference calls; statements and testimonies; and finally his writings, all arranged alphabetically by physical form and therein chronologically
Includes materials relating to Albert Wohlstetter's typescript comments on "Combat Radii of Soviet Fighter Escorts and Backfire Bomber," 1982 September 10
Includes an article by Brian Chow, 1982 June 25

did.unittitle: For Albert Wohlstetter. Briefing by Alan Fogelquist,

scopecontent.p: Includes presentations at seminars, symposia, and workshops, often attended by Roberta Wohlstetter as well. Also includes correspondence with Roberta Wohlstetter.

This series deals exclusively with her life and career and includes writings that she alone authored, while writings and studies co-authored with her husband are to be found in the other series. It consists of a biographical file including her achievements during her undergraduate and graduate years, awards received by her, a career file reflecting her association with the Rand Corporation and PanHeuristics, conferences she participated in, interviews, letters to the editor, notes, research materials used in her writings, speeches, her consulting work with various government agencies relating to defense issues, and finally her writings, arranged alphabetically by physical form
